data.title: The David Lean Cinema
data.text:
Category: Films

Hetain Patel Shorts

Hetain Patel Shorts at David Lean Cinema - September 2024

A series of screenings curated by artist Hetain Patel to coincide with Come As You Really Are, a free exhibition commissioned by Artangel currently open to the public in Croydon. Each film (see further below) has been selected for its’ personal resonance to Patel and is paired with a short film of his own, which relates thematically to the feature film. For more information and to book a visit to the exhibition (located in the old Grants buiilding) visit artangel.org.uk

Hetain Patel is a London-based artist and filmmaker, whose work challenges reductive categorisations of identity and art. Often rooted in personal experience, and that of his immigrant family, Patel’s work invites us to see identity as multi-dimensional and complex, linked as much to what we choose to do, as to that which is assigned by birth, heritage, social norms, and conventions.

Patel’s films, sculptures, live performances, paintings and photographs have been shown worldwide in galleries, theatres and on iconic public screens, including Piccadilly Circus, London, and Times Square, New York. His works have been presented at the Venice Biennale, Ullens Centre for Contemporary Art, Beijing and in London at institutions including Tate Modern and Sadler’s Wells.

Patel’s works are in public and private collections in the UK and internationally, including Tate, British Council, Arts Council England, Government Art Collection, Manchester Art Gallery, M+ Museum Hong Kong, KNMA New Delhi, and Fondazione In Between Art Film, Rome.

Regarding this series at The David Lean Cinema Hetain Patel says:

“Each of the 3 feature films have been hugely influential to my identity and also how I make films. Behind the fantastical thrill of them are deeply relatable approaches to learning how to become yourself – from imitation and wearing disguises, to faking it until you make it, they show there isn’t just one way to try this, and that its ok to get it wrong along the way”.

CROUCHING TIGER, HIDDEN DRAGON

2000 | Dir Ang Lee | 120m | Taiwan | Hong Kong

Saturday 07 September 2024 at 2.00pm

An Artangel presentation preceded by Hetain Patel’s short film DON’T LOOK AT THE FINGER – 2017 (Council Cert PG), – 16m

Ang Lee’s classic wuxia tale is the story of a legendary sword, the Green Destiny, which is stolen by an audacious thief, and the quest to return it to its rightful owner.

Play Video

Winner of 4 Oscars, Ang Lee’s classic wuxia tale tells the story of legendary swordsman Li Mu Bai, his partner Lu Shu Lien and the Green Destiny sword, which is stolen by an audacious thief. Lee revels in the balletic acrobatics that exemplify this genre of films, while luxuriating in the magnificent vistas of 19th century China. Mandarin and Chinese with English subtitles.

SPIDER-MAN

2002 | Dir Sam Raimi | 121m | USA

Saturday 14 September 2024 at 2.00pm

An Artangel presentation, preceded by Hetain Patel’s short film THE JUMP Part 2 – 2015 (Council Cert U) – 7m

After being bitten by a genetically-modified spider, a shy teenager gains spider-like abilities that he uses to fight injustice as a masked superhero and face a vengeful enemy.

Play Video

Tobey Maguire stars as Peter Parker, who is bitten by a genetically-modified spider and becomes a reluctant super-hero, taking on arch-villain the Green Goblin. With a stirring theme from Danny Elfman and some spectacular action sequences, this is the first of three collaborations between Tobey Maguire Maguire and Sam Raimi that breathed new life into the Marvel comic strip.

COMING TO AMERICA

1988 | Dir John Landis | 116m | USA

Saturday 28 September 2024 at 2.00pm

An Artangel presentation, preceded by Hetain Patel’s short film LANDING – 2022 (Council Cert U) – 10m

Pampered African Prince Akeem, realising he is being railroaded into a marriage of convenience by his father, escapes to the States and looks for a woman in Queens who he can respect for her strong will and intelligence.

Play Video

Five years after Trading Places, John Landis and Eddie Murphy re-team to bring Murphy’s script hilariously to the screen. Pampered African Prince Akeem is shocked to find he is being married off by his father. He and his manservant escape to New York to search Queens (where else!) for a woman who will love him for himself.

Pride Donation

Pride Donation

Rocky Horror Donation

Donations to a Pride charity – Rainbows Across Borders.

Processing ...

Listings

Scroll down for all scheduled screenings.

WILDING

2023 | Dir David Allen | 74m | UK

Wednesday 14 August 2024 at 7.30pm

A dying landscape that is healed against all odds, going on to thrive in astonishing ways.The film will be followed by a recorded Q&A with Isabella Tree, hosted by Craig Bennett of the Wildlife Trusts which was filmed at the Knepp Estate.

Play Video

Wilding tells the story of a young couple who backed nature to create a future for their failing, four-hundred-year-old estate. Battling entrenched tradition, and ripping down the fences, they allowed intensively-farmed land to return gradually to its natural condition, entrusting its recovery to a motley mix of animals both tame and wild. It began a grand experiment that has become one of the most significant rewilding experiments in Europe. Followed by a recorded Q&A with Isabella Tree.

THELMA

2024 | Dir Josh Margolin | 98m | USA

Thursday 15 August 2024 at 2.00pm *HOH

Thursday 15 August 2024 at 7.30pm

*HOH – Descriptive subtitles for those with hearing loss.

When 93-year-old Thelma Post gets duped by a phone scammer pretending to be her grandson, she sets out on a treacherous quest across the city to reclaim what was taken from her.

The 2.00pm screening will be followed by a discussion organised by the u3a Film Group.

Play Video

A poignant comedy in which June Squibb shines as the spirited 93-year-old Thelma Post. When a phone scam rattles her world, Thelma embarks on a daring quest to reclaim her lost savings, reluctantly teaming up with Ben (Richard Roundtree), a long-forgotten friend. Their journey through LA’s underbelly challenges Thelma’s independence and reconnects her with family and life’s unexpected pleasures. “What a joy to witness it” (The Guardian).

A GREYHOUND OF A GIRL (relaxed)

2023 | Dir Enzo D’Alò | 85m | Estonia | Ireland

Saturday 17 August 2024 at 11.00am

Relaxed screening for young people living with autism and other neurodiversity.

Based on a story by Roddy Doyle, this animated films tells the story of four generations. Mary is learning to cook, using the recipes of her beloved grandmother, who is gravely ill. Mary is befriended by a mysterious old lady full of family tales.

Play Video

Eleven-year-old Mary dreams of becoming a great chef, inspired by the delicious meals created by her beloved grandmother. However, Mary and her family must come to terms with her granny’s illness, helped by a mysterious visitor and a road trip across Ireland. Adopted from a novel by Roddy Doyle, this colourful animation provides some touching life lessons and a little bit of magic. Marvellous Makers – in association with Croydon Libraries and Leisure.

FLY ME TO THE MOON

2024 | Dir Greg Berlanti | 134m | USA

Tuesday 20 August 2024 at 7.30pm

Marketing maven Kelly Jones wreaks havoc on launch director Cole Davis’s already difficult task. When the White House deems the mission too important to fail, Jones is directed to stage a fake moon landing as back-up.

Play Video

A sharp, stylish comedy-drama set against the 1960s space race, Fly Me to the Moon follows NASA launch director Cole Davis (Channing Tatum) stressed about getting the Apollo 11 mission off the ground. Enter Kelly Jones (Scarlett Johansson), a marketing whiz tasked with spicing up NASA’s image. Their clash intensifies when Kelly is told to secretly film a fake moon landing as a desperate backup plan. Between the mission’s pressure and their undeniable chemistry, can they work together to achieve one giant leap for mankind?

THE NATURE OF LOVE

2023 | Dir Monia Chokri | 110m | Canada | France

Thursday 22 August 2024 at 2.30pm

Thursday 22 August 2024 at 7.30pm

Sophia’s life is turned upside down when she meets Sylvain. She comes from a wealthy family, while Sylvain comes from a family of manual workers. Sophia questions her own values after abandoning herself to her great romantic impulses.

Play Video

French-Canadian professor Sophia is in a longstanding, comfortable but passionless marriage. Her curiosity about infidelity turns into something real when she meets Sylvain, the strapping builder tasked with fixing up her country home. Opposites attract, and they quickly begin a tumultuous affair, but the differences between their family, friends and viewpoints become both hilarious and uncomfortable. It’s rare for a Quebecois film to find a UK release – this perceptive and sexy romcom justifies its breakthrough! French with English subtitles.

KENSUKE’S KINGDOM

2023 | Dir Neil Boyle | Kirk Hendry | 85m | UK | France

Tuesday 27 August 2024 at 2.30pm

Saturday 31 August 2024 at 2.00pm

Adapted from Michael Morpurgo’s beloved novel, a young boy shipwrecked on a Pacific island during a global sailing adventure. Guided by Kensuke, he learns survival skills and discovers unexpected friendship.

Includes a short introduction by Michael Morpurgo, the writer of the book that the film is based on.

Play Video

Adapted from Michael Morpurgo’s beloved novel (who will introduce the film), Kensuke’s Kingdom follows a young boy shipwrecked on a Pacific island during a global sailing adventure. Guided by Kensuke (voiced by Ken Watanabe), he learns survival skills and discovers unexpected friendship. With stunning animation and heartfelt performances, including Cillian Murphy as the Dad, this film brings Morpurgo’s poignant tale to life, exploring resilience, companionship, and the bonds that transcend oceans.

SHAYDA

2023 | Dir Noora Niasari | 117m | Australia

Tuesday 27 August 2024 at 7.30pm

A young Iranian mother and her six-year-old daughter find refuge in an Australian women’s shelter during the two weeks of the Iranian New Year.

Play Video

In this beautiful film about freedom and love, a young Iranian woman named Shayda flees her abusive husband in Iran and seeks refuge in a Melbourne women’s shelter with her six-year-old daughter, Mona. It’s the festive Nowruz holiday, but fear hangs heavy as Shayda tries to rebuild her life and secure a divorce. Her estranged husband, Hossein, arrives demanding visitation rights, threatening to take Mona back to Iran. Shayda grapples with the Australian shelter’s unfamiliar environment, cultural clashes, and the constant terror of discovery, all while fiercely protecting her daughter. English and Persian with English subtitles.

THE DEAD DON’T HURT

2023 | Dir Viggo Mortensen | 129m | Mexico | Canada

Wednesday 28 August 2024 at 7.30pm

Two pioneers fight for their lives and their love on the American frontier during the Civil War.

Play Video

Viggo Mortensen’s second directorial effort, The Dead Don’t Hurt is a well-executed western set in the 1860s. Mortensen stars alongside Vicky Krieps in this tale of immigrants striving to build a life in a corrupt Nevada town. Krieps shines as Vivienne Le Coudy, an irreverent and fiercely independent French-Canadian flower seller who refuses to wed but travels with Danish carpenter Holger Olsen (Mortensen) to Elk Flats. Facing the town’s corruption, led by Mayor Rudolph Schiller (Danny Huston) and rancher Alfred Jeffries (Garret Dillahunt), Vivienne’s resilience and passion highlight her determination to defy an unforgiving, male-dominated world.

THE BIKERIDERS

2023 | Dir Jeff Nichols | 116m | USA

Thursday 29 August 2024 at 2.30pm

Thursday 29 August 2024 at 7.30pm *HOH

*HOH – Descriptive subtitles for those with hearing loss.

In 1965, fiery Kathy (Jodie Comer) falls for Benny (Austin Butler), a member of the Chicago-based Vandals Motorcycle Club. As the club becomes increasingly associated with violence and crime, Benny is forced to choose between his loyalty to the brotherhood and his love for Kathy.

Play Video

In 1965, fiery Kathy (Jodie Comer) falls for Benny (Austin Butler), a member of the Chicago-based Vandals Motorcycle Club. Their whirlwind romance is captured by photographer Danny Lyon, who documents the club’s camaraderie. But tensions rise as the Vandals founder, Johnny, clashes with members who want to expand and form new chapters. As the club becomes increasingly associated with violence and crime, Benny is forced to choose between his loyalty to the brotherhood and his love for Kathy. “I bought in and found the film compelling from start to finish” (Leonard Maltin).

ROBOT DREAMS (Dementia Friendly)

2023 | Dir Pablo Berger | 106m | Spain | France

Tuesday 03 September 2024 at 11.00am (Dementia Friendly)

This beautiful silent movie (sounds and music, but no dialogue) is the story of Dog, who lives in Manhattan, and his friendship with the robot companion he builds for himself.

Play Video

A beautiful silent movie about the joy and fragility of friendship. A dog named Dog, who lives in Manhattan, is tired of being alone, and decides to build himself a robot companion. Their friendship grows until they become inseparable, but one summer night, Dog is forced to abandon his new best friend at the beach. Will they ever meet again? Nominated for Best Animated Feature at this year’s Oscars.

THE COMMANDANT’S SHADOW

2023 | Dir Daniela Volker | 103m | UK | USA

Tuesday 03 September 2024 at 7.30pm

A documentary about the son of Rudolf Höss, the Camp Commandant of Auschwitz, and how he confronts his father’s involvement in the Holocaust.

Play Video

Holocaust documentary, featuring interviews with former inmates and their families, as well as descendants of Auschwitz concentration camp director Rudolf Hoss. Raising questions about love, guilt and forgiveness as the two parties meet to discuss their family histories, it is also a story of hope, acceptance and compassion. Essential viewing for anyone moved by The Zone Of Interest.

BABES

2024 | Dir Pamela Adlon | 109m | USA

Thursday 05 September 2024 at 2.30pm

Thursday 05 September 2024 at 7.30pm

Friday 13 September 2024 at 11.00am (Babes In Arms screening)

Lifelong friends Eden and Dawn find their relationship is strained when Eden reacts to her pal’s second pregnancy with her husband by getting pregnant via a one-night stand.

Play Video

Childhood friends Eden (Ilana Glazer) and Dawn (Michelle Buteau) find their bond tested when Eden becomes pregnant after a one-night stand. Navigating the messy realities of pregnancy, the pair face laughter and tears as they figure out how to redefine their friendship amid the chaos. A raw and hilarious look at motherhood and female friendship.

CROUCHING TIGER, HIDDEN DRAGON

2000 | Dir Ang Lee | 120m | Taiwan

Saturday 07 September at 2.00pm

An Artangel presentation

Booking and full details here

SLEEP

2023 | Dir Jason Yu | 95m | South Korea

Tuesday 10 September 2024 at 7.30pm

Pregnant with their first child, Soo-jin becomes worried about her and her baby when her husband Hyun-su starts exhibiting worrying habits, including sleepwalking.

Play Video

One night, Soo-jin discovers her husband Hyeon-soo sleepwalking, and behaving in a disturbing manner. As time goes on, she becomes more and more uneasy as night falls, for fear that he will harm their newborn child, and the stakes are elegantly raised to bring us a potent mix of marital comedy and mysterious terrors. Sadly, this is amongst the final films of the late Lee Sun-kyun, star of Parasite, whose director Bong Joon-ho called Sleep “The most unique horror film and the smartest debut film I’ve seen in ten years”. Korean with English subtitles.

ALL OF US STRANGERS

2023 | Dir Andrew Haigh | 105m | UK

Wednesday 11 September 2024 at 7.30pm

Acclaimed director Andrew Haigh, who grew up in Sanderstead, returns to his childhood home for this story of a young gay man trying to come to terms with the loss of his parents when he was a boy.

There is an accompanying walking tour (14 Sept) of local locations used in the film. See here.

Play Video

A ghost story set in Croydon. An orphaned writer searches Sanderstead for his childhood home, and finds far more than he ever expected. Meanwhile, he also begins a relationship with a troubled neighbour in his high-rise flat. Enjoy this encore performance of one of the year’s most acclaimed films, a generation-spanning conversation about love, grief and what we expect from each other.

TWISTERS

2024 | Dir Lee Isaac Chung | 122m | USA

Thursday 12 September 2024 at 2.30pm

Thursday 12 September 2024 at 7.30pm *HOH

*HOH – Descriptive subtitles for those with hearing loss.

Wednesday 25 September 2024 at 5.30pm

Retired storm chaser Kate Cooper and annoying social-media superstar Tyler Owens are soon getting in each other’s way as they track a deadly series of storm systems across central Oklahoma.

Play Video

Don’t miss your chance to see one of the summer’s biggest blockbusters. A meteorologist (Daisy Edgar-Jones) is lured back to Oklahoma by a groundbreaking tracking project, where she meets a storm chasing social media star Tyler Owens (Glen Powell). Amidst escalating tornadoes, the pair navigate the action, while fighting to protect the communities from both natural and human threats.

KENSUKE’S KINGDOM (relaxed)

2023 | Dir Neil Boyle | Kirk Hendry | UK | France

Saturday 14 September 2024 at 11.00am

Relaxed screening for young people living with autism and other neurodiversity.

Adapted from Michael Morpurgo’s beloved novel, a young boy is shipwrecked on a Pacific island during a global sailing adventure. Guided by Kensuke, he learns survival skills and discovers unexpected friendship.

Play Video

Adapted from Michael Morpurgo’s beloved novel, Kensuke’s Kingdom follows a young boy shipwrecked on a Pacific island during a global sailing adventure. Guided by Kensuke (Ken Watanabe), he learns survival skills and discovers unexpected friendship. With stunning animation and heartfelt performances, including Cillian Murphy as the Dad, this film brings Morpurgo’s poignant tale to life, exploring resilience, companionship, and the bonds that transcend oceans.

ALL OF US STRANGERS – LOCATIONS WALK

Saturday 14 September 2024 at 2pm

Join us for a volunteer led film locations walking tour through Sanderstead, Croydon. The tour meeting point will be Riddlesdown station where 2 members of The David Lean Cinema will greet you. We will be stopping off at some of the main locations that were used for the filming of All of Us Strangers. The tour end point will be Sanderstead Station around 4.00pm.

Full details here

SPIDER-MAN

2002 | Dir Sam Raimi | 121m | USA

Saturday 14 September 2024 at 2.00pm

An Artangel presentation

Booking and full details here

THE IPCRESS FILE

1965 | Dir Sidney J. Furie | 109m | UK

Tuesday 17 September 2024 at 7.30pm

Michael Caine stars as Harry Palmer, trying to work out why a prominent scientist has disappeared, while being thrown off the trail by his superiors.

Play Video

Michael Caine plays Harry Palmer, Len Deighton’s antidote to James Bond. Fighting both the class war and the Cold War, Palmer investigates the kidnapping of a scientist in an attempt to get to the bottom of what information is contained within The Ipcress File. A standout blend of Caine’s sardonic style and Furie’s visual gymnastics, capped with John Barry’s iconic theme, we’re proud to present an original Technicolor print of this classic sixties British spy thriller. A 35mm presentation in association with The Cinema Museum.

TOUCH

2024 | Baltasar Kormákur | 121m | Iceland | UK

Wednesday 18 September 2024 at 7.30pm

Fearing he has little time to live, widower Kristófer goes in search of the young woman he loved and lost 50 years ago in this tender romantic odyssey.

Play Video

Following his doctor’s advice, Kristófer, an elderly man living in Iceland, decides to seek out his lost love from decades past. He returns to London where they first met, and explores her home country of Japan, as the film switches between his present day quest and beautifully shot flashbacks of how the young lovers drifted apart. “The film’s embrace of compassion and forgiveness for everyone is heartwarmingly spacious. It shimmers with grace” (RogerEbert.com). Icelandic with English subtitles.

WIDOW CLICQUOT

2023 | Dir Thomas Napper | 89m | USA | UK

Thursday 19 September 2024 at 2.30pm *HOH

Thursday 19 September 2024 at 7.30pm

*HOH – Descriptive subtitles for those with hearing loss.

The story of Barbe-Nicole Ponsardin, who took over the wine business of her husband when she was widowed at the age of 27, and made it an international brand and her one of France’s first female entrepreneurs.

Play Video

After her husband’s death, Barbe-Nicole Ponsardin Clicquot flouts 18th century convention by assuming the reins of the fledgling wine business they had nurtured together. The business gets a boost due to the Champagne mania that seized Russia during the Napoleonic Wars. But she is also chained to the past, remembering how she and her husband planned to design the perfect vineyard. Steering the company through dizzying political and financial reversals, she defies her critics and revolutionizes the champagne industry to become one of the world’s first great businesswomen.

ABOUT DRY GRASSES

2023 Dir Nuri Bilge Ceylan | 197m | Turkey | France

Saturday 21 September at 1.00pm

Award-winning Turkish auteur Ceylan’s latest masterwork is the story of a self-centred and frustrated school teacher stuck in an Anatolian backwater, whose actions cause his friends and charges pain.

Play Video

Turkey’s great cinema auteur returns to the Anatolian region to present the story of Samet, an art teacher longing to escape his enforced post and return to teach in his native Istanbul. During an endless snowy school term, Samet’s cynicism and self-interest are exposed when he is (rightly) accused of inappropriate behaviour with his young charges. But this may not even be the worst of his actions… Ceylan takes his time, but the beauty of the images, as well as some cinematic coups later in the story and the brilliant performances of Celiloğlu and Dizdar, repay the viewer’s patience in spades. Turkish with English subtitles.

THE BEAST

2023 | Dir Bertrand Bonello | 145m | France | Canada

Tuesday 24 September 2024 at 7.00pm

Lea Seydoux and George MacKay play a man and a woman in three different time-zones, The present, the Belle Epoque and the 2040s, in three different tales about human emotions.

Play Video

Lea Seydoux and George MacKay feature as Gabrielle and Louis, star-crossed lovers in three different time-zones. Gabrielle (Seydoux) bounces from 2044, where human emotion has almost been eradicated to Paris in 1910 and LA in 2014, as an actor replicating feelings in front of a green screen. One strand remains constant, though, her draw to Louis while filled with a fear of what’s to come. Inspired by 1903’s Henry James novella, The Beast In the Jungle, The Beast explores ideas of free will, eternal recurrence and asks is serenity worth the cost of the pain of art? “Bertrand Bonello’s mesmeric blend of sci-fi, horror and romance, feels frighteningly plausible” (The Independent). French with English subtitles.

CROSSING

2024 | Levan Akin | 106m | Sweden | Denmark

Thursday 26 September 2024 at 2.30pm

Thursday 26 September 2024 at 7.30pm

Retired teacher Lia has promised her dying sister that she will find her niece Tekla, a trans woman who fled to Istanbul. With one of her ex-pupils in tow, she travels to the city on what seems like a hopeless quest.

Play Video

From acclaimed director Levan Akin, Crossing is a tale of identity and unlikely connection. Lia, a retired school teacher living in Georgia, hears from a young neighbour Achi that her long lost niece Tekla, a transgender woman, has crossed the border into Turkey. Hoping to reunite with Tekla after years apart, Lia travels to Istanbul with the unpredictable Achi to find her. While they explore the city, they cross paths with a transgender lawyer called Evrim, who helps them in their search. Compassionate and heartfelt, director Akin encourages the viewer to consider overcoming the degrees of separation that divide us all. Georgian with English subtitles.

COMING TO AMERICA

1988 | Dir John Landis | 116m | USA

Saturday 28 September 2024 at 2.00pm

An Artangel presentation

Booking and full details here

Back To Top

ICOMS

2023 | Dir Blitz Bazawule | 141m | USA

Cast: Fantasia Barrino, Taraji P. Henson, Danielle Brooks, Colman Domingo, Corey Hawkins, H.E.R., Halle Bailey, Phylicia Pearl Mpasi, Ciara, Aunjanue Ellis

In Blitz Bazawule’s adaptation of The Color Purple, the indomitable spirit of Celie Harris, portrayed by Taraji P. Henson, unfolds against the backdrop of early 20th-century America. Enduring the harrowing trials of abuse, forced marriage, and separation from her sister Nettie, Celie’s life takes an unexpected turn when she forges a powerful connection with the spirited jazz singer Shug Avery (H.E.R.). As the narrative weaves through decades, Celie’s resilience, bolstered by the unwavering support of friends like Sofia (Danielle Brooks) and Mary Agnes (Fantasia Barrino), leads to a triumphant reunion with Nettie and the reclamation of familial ties. With a stellar ensemble cast and a stirring blend of soulful music, The Color Purple is a poignant exploration of sisterhood & empowerment.

Wednesday 03 April 2024 at 7pm The Arts Bar will open from 6pm serving drinks and snacks.

All tickets £10

Trailer below…….

Play Video

Six black women discuss the film and the close bond that exists in black female sisterhood.

Sisterhood: A Short Film produced in partnership with The Color Purple.

Director: Amber Akaunu

Producer: Jendella Benson

Florist: Teanne Andrews

Featuring: Tobi Oredein, Charlene Badibanga, Victora Sanusi, Jasmine Braithwaite, Anyika Onuora, Nkechi Onuora.

Play Video

1996 | Dir F. Gary Gray | 123m | USA

Cast: Jada Pinkett Smith, Queen Latifah, Vivica A.Fox

Four Black women, all of whom have suffered for lack of money and at the hands of the majority, undertake to rob banks. While initially successful, a policeman who was involved in shooting one of the women’s brothers is on their trail. As the women add to the loot, their tastes and interests begin to change and their suspicions of each other increase on the way to a climactic robbery.

“Set It Off is a lot more than a thriller about four women who rob banks. It compares with WAITING TO EXHALE, but with a strong jolt of reality. It creates a portrait of the lives of these women that’s so observant and informed.” The movie surprised and moved me; I expected a routine action picture and was amazed how much I started to care about the characters. Roger Ebert

Wednesday 10 April 2024 at 7.30pm

Trailer below…..

Play Video

Finding Us

Finding Us

If visiting us for the first time, allow extra time to find us as we have limited signage visible from the street and we are in the middle of a large building.

We are located in Katharine Street, Croydon CR9 1ET and the entrance is next door to The Spreadeagle pub and Clocktower Cafe. This entrance is for Croydon Central Library but as you go in, veer off left and go upstairs to the first floor where the entrance to the Arts Bar and Cinema is down a ramp opposite the escalator. This escalator can be used from the ground floor if you cannot manage the stairs and can be found at the end of the atrium, past the stairs from the ground floor.

We do not screen advertisements and show minimal trailers so programmes start at their advertised time.

We are 10 minutes walk from East Croydon and West Croydon train stations. More detailed information is here.

Back to cinema listings

Vacancies

Current vacancies:

Fundraiser

Publicity and Outreach Manager

David Lean Cinema Gift Voucher Application

David Lean Cinema Gift Voucher Application Form

Following submission of this form, you will receive an invoice by email with a clickable link to pay by credit or debit card. We will then confirm payment and send your voucher(s) by email with a PDF attachment.

Christmas Quiz Fundraiser

The Big Christmas Quiz Fundraiser

Get into the holiday spirit; gather your friends and family for a festive quiz night filled with brain-teasing questions and heartwarming holiday cheer. With our special guest hosts leading the way, you’re in for a night of laughter, entertainment, and great company.

Best of all, your participation goes towards raising much-needed funds for the cinema.

Venue: Croydon Clocktower Cafe, Katharine St, CR9 1ET (Entry via main library entrance)

Food, drink and bar open from 5.30pm

Quiz starts at 7pm

Special guest hosts acting as Quizmasters: Joanna Scanlan (cinema patron) and Tobias Menzies (Prince Philip, The Crown). Raffle and quiz prizes to be won.

If you want to make it a full day of fun, don’t miss our pre-quiz film THE MUPPET CHRISTMAS CAROL screening at 4pm (Needs to be booked separately). It’s the perfect way to kick off the festivities!

CHRISTMAS QUIZ TICKETS 04 December from 5.30pm SOLD OUT

THE MUPPET CHRISTMAS CAROL 04 December 2023 at 4pm
